instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD1: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD1? PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 is a power rail that powers the soldered on SSDs.
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Hi, got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power. 

<CAPACITOR>C9581</CAPACITOR> was corroded and replaced. 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.26 v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> = 5.1v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_T</SIGNAL> = 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL> = 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> = 1.8v

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Corrosion near <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> sounds bad.
Check diode mode to ground on L9080/580; compare with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Sorry, i dont have a good board to compare.

L9080 = 0.374

L9580 = 0.358

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
The values look good.

Do you get SSD voltages?
Tried DFU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
May have luck changing <CHIP>U9580</CHIP>.
Be sure all <RESISTOR>R9580</RESISTOR>/1/3/8 are good.

Just in case, be sure <RESISTOR>R9598</RESISTOR> is also good.
